required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Interactive Effects of IV Ethanol and IV Nicotine
clinical_study.official_title: A Laboratory Study on the Interactive Effects of IV Ethanol and IV Nicotine on Subjective Effects and Cognition

collaborator.agency: South Central VA Mental Illness Research, Education & Clinical Center

brief_summary.textblock: There are mixed reports on nicotine's effects on ethanol-induced impairment in cognitive performance and behavior in humans. The main objective of this study is to characterize the interactive effects of acute intravenous (IV) ethanol and nicotine administration on cognition and behavior in healthy smokers. The general hypothesis is that nicotine will attenuate the negative effects of ethanol on cognition and subjective stimulant/sedative effects of ethanol.

primary_outcome.description: A 14-item scale with 7 items designed to assess stimulant effects associated with the ascending limb of ethanol intoxication and 7 items developed to measure sedative effects associated with the descending limb of ethanol intoxication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Visual Analog Scales of Mood States
secondary_outcome.description: The following items will be assessed: high, depressed, anxious, drowsy, irritable, tired, sad, angry, nervous, nauseous, blurred vision, flushed, headache, lightheaded, dizzy, sweating, abdominal discomfort and tingling .

A measure of smoking urges reflecting not only intent and desire to smoke, and anticipation of pleasure from smoking, but also anticipation of relief from negative affect and nicotine withdrawal, and urgent and overwhelming desire to smoke.
A test of psychomotor performance, which measures motor persistence, sustained attention, response speed and visuomotor coordination.

arm_group.arm_group_label: intravenous ethanol placebo and nicotine infusions
arm_group.description: Each subject will participate in three separate interventions. Each intervention will include three nicotine infusions (placebo and 2 active conditions). The interventions will differ on the ethanol infusion: placebo or one of two ethanol concentrations.

Each subject will participate in three separate interventions. Each intervention will include three nicotine infusions (placebo and 2 active conditions). The interventions will differ on the ethanol infusion: placebo or one of two ethanol concentrations.

Each subject will participate in three separate interventions. Each intervention will include three nicotine infusions (placebo and 2 active conditions). The interventions will differ on the ethanol infusion: placebo or one of two ethanol concentrations.

intervention.intervention_name: Intravenous ethanol placebo plus nicotine infusions
intervention.description: nicotine infusions: 1) placebo; 2) nicotine 0.5 mg/70 kg; 3) nicotine 1.0 mg/70 kg
intervention.arm_group_label: intravenous ethanol placebo and nicotine infusions

intervention.description: nicotine infusions: 1) placebo; 2) nicotine 0.5 mg/70 kg; 3) nicotine 1.0 mg/70 kg
nicotine infusions: 1) placebo; 2) nicotine 0.5 mg/70 kg; 3) nicotine 1.0 mg/70 kg
